author: ralexstokes
content: i would like to consider a small modification to 4844 so that it exposes the underlying BLS curve arithmetic as precompiles, rather than the currently monolithic "point evaluation" precompile (cf. `verify_kzg_proof` in the EIP spec)

author: ralexstokes
content:
the downside is expanded scope and corresponding requirements for more testing, review, etc.

but on the upside we will have something like EIP-2537 which has been "almost to mainnet" for some time and unlocks a lot of use cases around both consensus layer (e.g. more staking pool designs) and zk rollups (which can use the more secure curve over the existing altbn256)

author: ralexstokes
content: the underlying code will already be required for 4844 so this is mainly about exposing the logic via the 4844 interface, rather than adding new functionality
